about.description:
The Spatial Interaction Modeling (SpInt) module provides a collection of
tools to study spatial interaction processes and analyze spatial
interaction data.
about.summary: Efficient calibration of spatial interaction models in Python

name: spint
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "spint" %}
{% set version = "1.0.6" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 64beb8bf3daaf299d6b0ca6051d2c2213129c09e62fd0a0e6f36374a88b8e9c8

build:
  noarch: python
  number: 0
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps --ignore-installed --no-cache-dir -vvv"

requirements:
  host:
    - python >=3
    - pip
  run:
    - python >=3
    - scipy >=0.11
    - numpy >=1.3
    - libpysal >=4.0.0
    - spglm >=1.0.7
    - spreg >=1.0.4

test:
  imports:
    - spint

about:
  home: http://pysal.org/
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  license_family: BSD
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  summary: 'Efficient calibration of spatial interaction models in Python'

  description: |
    The Spatial Interaction Modeling (SpInt) module provides a collection of
    tools to study spatial interaction processes and analyze spatial
    interaction data.
  doc_url: http://readthedocs.org/projects/spint
  dev_url: http://github.com/pysal/spint

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - TaylorOshan
